title: Mathematics Instructional Design Workshop Using Cognitive Process Analysis Techniques

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: A hybrid environment emphasizing digital device-based practice and group collaboration, exploring applicability to real lesson design for in-service elementary teachers.

learning_goals: Learners can design mathematics instructional materials by applying cognitive load theory.
Learners can explain methods to integrate cognitive process analysis techniques—such as concept mapping and eye-tracking—into teaching methodologies.
Learners can develop a prototype that improves mathematics lesson design by reflecting formative assessment results.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
